head.title: From Banker to Baker in TriBeCa

hedline.hl1: From Banker to Baker in TriBeCa

abstract.p: New bakery Tribeca Treats offers cupcakes in variety of flavors along with other sweets; photo (S)

block.p: You can't open a bakery in New York without cupcakes these days, so Rachel Thebault, a former investment banker who has opened Tribeca Treats, offers small ones ($2 each) aswirl with chocolate, vanilla, coconut, espresso, peanut butter, caramel or marshmallow frostings. There is even a red velvet one with cream cheese icing. Her sandwich cookies are also modest in size and come in chocolate, vanilla, peanut and graham cracker with various cream fillings, $1.25 each or $18 a dozen. Chocolates and cakes round out the inventory. The shop also sells gift items. It's at 94 Reade Street (Church Street), (212) 571-0500.

There is even a red velvet one with cream cheese icing. Her sandwich cookies are also modest in size and come in chocolate, vanilla, peanut and graham cracker with various cream fillings, $1.25 each or $18 a dozen. Chocolates and cakes round out the inventory. The shop also sells gift items. It's at 94 Reade Street (Church Street), (212) 571-0500. FOOD STUFF
